alert.note: Alert for Mellette and Todd Counties; Tripp County (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 07 at 3:00AM MST until November 07 at 5:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THIS MORNING THOUGH THIS AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR SOUTH CENTRAL SOUTH DAKOTA AND PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST SOUTH DAKOTA... .DISCUSSION...South winds will increase this morning and continue through this afternoon with gusts of 40 to 50 mph. Relative humidity will drop to around 20 percent this afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 334 AND 335... The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 10 AM this morning to 5 PM MST this afternoon. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 334 Mellette and Todd Counties and 335 Tripp County. * WINDS...Southeast 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 22 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Mellette and Todd Counties; Tripp County
